snippet: After a crime on Staten Island, a face tattoo of a red lightning bolt led the police to a man in Detroit, who offered proof that they had the wrong man.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column examines case of Dylan Vok, wrongly identified by New York City police as a suspect in a Staten Island robbery despite fact he had long since relocated to Detroit; Vok himself contacted New York detectives from Detroit after reading about the crime and seeing an old mug shot identifying him as the robber, offering proof they had the wrong man.
lead_paragraph: After a crime on Staten Island, a face tattoo of a red lightning bolt led the police to a man in Detroit, who offered proof that they had the wrong man.

headline.main: A Suspect With an Incriminating Tattoo Saves Face
headline.print_headline: A Suspect With an Incriminating Tattoo Saves Face
